page.title: 02 St Mary's Church
page.content:
The church was built 500 yrs ago at the end of Henry V11's reign. It was built with lava stone and was finished in 1500.
There are 85 steps up to the tower and there are 8 bells in the belfry. 6 of these are old and 2 are fairly new. At the top of the tower is a weather vane that was put up in 1862. The clock had its face replaced about 6 yrs ago.
Outside there is an old cross damaged by Cromwell's men in the Civil War. It was probably put in the churchyard for safety.
The rector of the church is Rev.A. Watson who has been rector for nearly 14 yrs.
